Mr. Miller
August 28, 1968
A personal note. The Motts are enjoying life in the
east though we’ve been kept busy getting settled through
most of this month. The weather has been typical —
record high temperatures and exceedingly high hunidity.
We were managing that in good shape until last Friday
when the air conditioning went out in our apartment.
(Stop smilingI) We were saved by the swimming pool
through the weekend and a delightful cool front that
moved in Sunday night. It was 82 yesterday and about
78 for the high Tuesday. Delightful!
I cannot visualize Warren Bishop in your role. He
believes in a closed campus society and the flow of
information will be curtailed. I am sorry it is
happening for the university we both love will suffer.
Sincerely,
RAMslkl
Enclosure
Robert A. Mott
